muscle.core.conduit.filter
Class DropFilter

java.lang.Object
  muscle.core.conduit.filter.DropFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter<DataWrapper>, WrapperFilter<DataWrapper>
public class DropFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements WrapperFilter<DataWrapper>

drops data if incoming time scale is not a multiple of outgoing dt, newInDt is only required to build the corresponding DataTemplate for incomming data use for testing, usually better try to not send the dropped data at all from within the CA

Author:
Jan Hegewald

          description of incomming data.
 void put(DataWrapper newInData)
          usually modify data here and pass to next filter/device) note: usually the filters shoult try to modify the data in place, so do not cache the pointer to the data passed to the next filter, as its contents might be changed

getInTemplate

public DataTemplate getInTemplate()
Description copied from interface: WrapperFilter
description of incomming data. most filters try to generate this at runtime from the in-template of their successive filter
